results.title: The Beautiful troublemaker = La Belle noiseuse
results.creator_credit: Jacques Rivette, Martine Marignac, George Reinhart Productions and Pierre Grise Productions
results.brief_description: A film dramatically uncovering the process of creating art, in particular nude portrait painting. Set in rural France, Nicholas and girlfriend Marianne (Emmanuelle Beart) are affected by a visit to a local artist’s stone mansion. The artist is a former famous painter Frenhofer (Michel Piccoli) who lives with his wife (Jane Birkin). Frenhofer wants Marianne to model for him and Nicholas, also an artist, pushes her to do it. A long film in two parts, director Jacques Rivette shows the development and challenges to the artist and his muse. Tension and soul searching evolves as an outcome of the creative process and painting technique is shown for each work (based on paintings by Bernard Dufour). Based on a book by Honore De Balzac. Winner of the Grand Prix at the 1991 Cannes Film Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques Rivette, Martine Marignac, George Reinhart Productions and Pierre Grise Productions

results.title: Pop & op art
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History through art”.
Surveys the two art movements known as pop and op art, showing examples from the work of pop and op artists, quoting their expressed intentions and attitudes, and comparing pop and op art with earlier art movements.

results.title: The Beast = La Bete [DVD] (E)
results.creator_credit: Walerian Borowczyk, Anatole Dauman and Argos Films
results.brief_description: Banned for many years, this erotic re-working of the “Beauty and the Beast” fairytale by Polish director Walerian Borowczyk is a bizarre mix of melodrama, horror, farce, satire, porn and broad humour. On the eve of her wedding, an American heiress, betrothed to the mentally unstable heir of a French aristocratic dynasty, is beset by sexual fantasies about a rapacious beast. Her imagination is triggered by rumours she hears that such a lustful beast lived in the grounds of the estate in the 18th century, and copulated with the beautiful young lady of the house. Borowczyk’s all out assault on social conventions and repressed desires can be seen as signposting both the peak of his sexual fables (Blanche, Immoral Tales), and his subsequent decline into soft porn. Contains graphic sexual imagery. Cast: Sirpa Lane, Lisbeth Hummel, Elisabeth Kahson, Pierre Benedetti, Marcel Dalio. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Bear and the mouse
results.creator_credit: I Remmier, F Remmier and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A variation on Aesop’s classic fable in which mice aid the escape of a bear in return for past favours. Shows real animals doing exactly what the story requires. A bear catches a mouse, but eventually the freed mouse chews an escape route for his trapped benefactor, illustrating the point that the weak can sometimes help the strong. Suitable for Lower Primary level students.

results.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
results.creator_credit: Leo McCarey, Rainbow Educational Video and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A battle of wits emerges between Father O’Malley and Sister Benedict when their ideas clash in how the children should be taught at St. Mary’s School. However, Sister Benedict takes a tip from his unusual methods and buys a boxing book and a baseball bat, then finds herself in the business of making men out of boys. It’s not Father O’Malley’s only battle. The school is badly in need of repairs and a cynical millionaire has started proceedings to condemn the school building. Starring Ingrid Bergman and Bing Crosby.

results.title: The Beach = La Plage
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Gervais, Francine Desbiens and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film touches upon the theme of solitude and is a fantasy that leaves the viewer free to speculate. A woman drowns, unnoticed by three men sitting with their backs to the sea. Two of them are throwing dice; the third is drinking a glass of water.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Suzanne Gervais, Francine Desbiens and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Belle of New York
results.creator_credit: Charles Walters, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A musical set in New York in the 1890s in which a playboy seeks redemption in the arms of a mission girl. This is the pretext for transforming Astaire’s past decadence into present zaniness and Vera-Ellen’s primness into sauciness. Despite the suggestion of fairytale fantasy - lovers truly in love can literally walk on air - this is at core a folk musical with an idealised New York as a slightly larger version of hometown, a community to be celebrated. Several lively dance numbers are designed to evoke the paintings of Currier and Ives. This was Astaire’s personal favourite of his musicals. Cast also includes Marjorie Main, Keenan Wynn, Alice Pearce, Clinton Sundberg, Gale Robbins. Music by Harry Warren, lyrics by Johnny Mercer.

results.title: The Bedford incident
results.creator_credit: James B. Harris, Richard Widmark, Columbia and Bedford Productions
results.brief_description: During a routine peacetime patrol in the Greenland Straits, the USS Bedford’s sonar picks up an unidentified submarine. The destroyer’s commander, Captain Finlander, (Richard Widmark), relentlessly pursues the lurking sub as a training exercise for his crew, keeping his men at battle stations for hours. Top-flight photo-journalist, Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) and NATO observer Schrepke (Eric Portman), try to warn him about this dangerous game, however Finlander is determined to win at all costs. A gripping “Cold War” classic.

results.title: The Beguiled
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Malpaso Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A wounded Union soldier is discovered by a young student from a crumbling Louisiana girls’ school during the Civil War. The academy takes their prize in and cares for him, and the cunning, mysterious soldier uses the all-female situation to coolly play off each of his captors to his own advantage. This carefully manuoevred sexual powderkeg finally explodes and the film spirals downwards into a pit of released repression and psychological horror. Stars Clint Eastwood and Geraldine Page. Based on the novel by Thomas Cullinan.
